definition: to patrol at night, marking the time by sounding clappers or gongs
to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)

sentences.english: As the development of RFID, it's possible to make a new patrol system.
sentences.chinese: 射频识别技术的发展，使得研制这种巡更机成为可能。

sentences.english: In order to solve the problems, electronic patrolling system came into being.
sentences.chinese: 为了解决这一矛盾问题，电子巡更系统应运而生了。

sentences.english: In order to solve the problem of this contradiction, electronic patrol system is adopted.
sentences.chinese: 为了解决这一矛盾问题，电子巡更系统应运而生了。

sentences.english: The court is interlinked, convenient aisle roof night tour more used.
sentences.chinese: 各院房顶有走道相通，便于夜间巡更护院。

definition: (of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to sound the night watches (on clappers or gongs, in former times)
to inspect one by one/to list individually
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
